 @param token The address of the authorised token contract

devdoc.author: Roberto Garca (http://rhizomik.net/~roberto/)

params.amount: Amount of stake on the registered token to add
params.hash: Hash identifying the item to get stake, for instance IPFS Base58 Hash
Hash identifying the item, for instance IPFS Base58 Hash

isStaked(string).details: Used to check if the corresponding item has a current stake bigger than 0.

params.hash: Hash identifying the item to get stake, for instance IPFS Base58 Hash

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.amount: Amount of stake on the registered token to remove
params.hash: Hash identifying the item to loose stake, for instance IPFS Base58 Hash

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.token: The address of the authorised token contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Library to implement items that can accumulate stake

addStake(uint256,string).notice: Adds `amount` stake on the registered token to the item with `hash`.

isStakable(string).notice: Checks if the item with `hash` can have stake, depending on implementation. For instance, the item is already registered.

isStaked(string).notice: Check if the stakable `hash` has some stake.

removeStake(uint256,string).notice: Removes `amount` of stake on the registered token from the item with `hash`.

setToken(address).notice: Sets the `token` address authorised to add and remove stake.
